Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> I messaged ACPool through their Discord channel about mining the wrong Hush chain. Directed them back here if they need to get in contact.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Pixelised thanks, you are a pretty swell internet person üíï

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hopefully all/most exchanges have been notified and got the message. If they choose to keep mining the old chain, I can't stop them

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Zcash would turn off their nodes forcibly after 16 weeks, but radix42 + I changed that to many years in the future in the Hush, because it always caused problems, and seemed against Satoshi's Vision, I guess

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so those old Hush nodes will run for many years if given the chance. It provides us a research + development playground to study Sprout attacks as well, and 51% attacks as it does not have DPoW anymore

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 52 weeks past block 800,000, is when those old hush nodes will run. That is around 3-4 years I think, too tired to do the actual math

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> You might see a Hush Classic down the track.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> Because there's less competition, those miners are getting more old Hush coins...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> Going by the mining stats for miners from those pools.
